For serious injury this can basically kill you because you eventually don't have enough blood to keep the heart or brain Alive. This is why you put pressure on a wound or you tourniquet the area so that blood just can't flow to that extremity.  Less severe injuries it means the heart compensates by going faster. It also means platelets are going to clot and block where you are bleeding to eventually stabilize.", "It beats faster to push what blood you do have to where your body still needs it. It also means platelets are going to clot and block where you are bleeding to eventually stabilize.", "If you track 7 points, that's a 7-dimensional vector! Way more complicated than tiny little 4D quaternion.  Quaternions are more intimidating than their actual level of difficulty. The basic operation of a quaternion is that you use 3 components to define the axis of rotation, and then the fourth component to define the degree of rotation about that axis.", "If you track 7 points, that's a 7-dimensional vector! Way more complicated than tiny little 4D quaternion.  Quaternions are more intimidating than their actual level of difficulty. The basic operation of a quaternion is that you use 3 components to define the axis of rotation, and then the fourth component to define the degree of rotation about that axis.", "If you track 7 points, that's a 7-dimensional vector! Way more complicated than tiny little 4D quaternion.  Quaternions are more intimidating than their actual level of difficulty. The basic operation of a quaternion is that you use 3 components to define the axis of rotation, and then the fourth component to define the degree of rotation about that axis."]
